intro: Meibomia uncinata, commonly known as the hookleaf meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Meibomia uncinata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
